reviews.text: This sculpture has been finished by Gloria (Storm) and, sorry, this is no tragedy. I wondered about the Name and I wondered about "Art" means today....

I consider myself a love of abstract art... but  this one isn't for me. Just me, or is it just me?  I didn't go there to look at this sculpture though. The general area is by the sea, has many seafood restaurants and several local parks; a stroll around is very pleasant.

It was nice to see but you wouldn’t need an hour. The surroundings make it worth a look. I wouldn’t go out of my way to view unless you had a particular interest in this type of sculpture or the artist.

Looked good, but I just couldn’t understand where the title of David and Goliath cane from. 

The descriptions says duration is about an hour. More like 5 minutes while crossing the road for a picture in my opinion. 

All in all nothing wrong, but I guess I’m not a great lover of modern art.

I simply could not visualise how this art-piece is representative of David & Goliath, no matter how hard I tried. It was erected in the Parc de Les Cascades in 1992 and is constructed of  a large white rectangular steel piece supported by three twisting stainless steel legs. This is a white face representing sheets drying in the wind and is intended to evoke memories of the long demolished neighbourhood. 
Now, I could not see David & Goliath and I certainly could see sheets drying and I fail to understand how there are two interpretations for this sculpture. Feel free to message me through Trip Advisor if you can assist.

Nobody could've ever guessed the theme of this modern sculpture, hadn't there been a sign there.
Skip it.
On the way to the beach at Olympic Park right down from the casino. It kinda looks like one of the tripods from war of the worlds
You must go to Parc de les Cascades on Montjuïc. The place shown on tripAdvisor corresponds to Jardins del Príncep de Girona. A quiet spot to rest but without touristic interest.

I first saw this from the HOHO bus and had to get off to take a photo. I've since googled it and know this very strange sculpture is there to remind us of the old and squalid neighbourhood that was once that was demolished.
I saw this on the bus and i loved it. It really makes a statement. Just another free thing to see in beautiful barcelona.

This is a huge Sculpture that one can see from below or above when on a local or a tour bus 

It is a modern sculpture that could be interpreted in many ways although is supposed to be David and Goliath

David & Goliath Sculpture is designed by Antoni Llena in 1992.
It is situated in Parc de Les Cascades, close to the oplympic city.
The sculpture is funny, but not important.
